required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 13, 2015
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Use-Results Surveillance Study of Harvoni® in Japanese Patients With Chronic Genotype 1 Hepatitis C Virus Infection
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Observational Post-Marketing Study of Harvoni in Japanese Patients With Genotype 1 Chronic Hepatitis C Infection

oversight_info.authority: Japan: Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of Harvoni® (ledipasvir/sofosbuvir (LDV/SOF) fixed-dose combination (FDC)) treatment under real world use in Japan. Among adult patients with chronic genotype 1 hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection and treated with Harvoni in routine clinical use, the primary objective of this study is to evaluate the incidence of adverse drug reactions (ADRs) under real world settings.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Ecologic or Community, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse drug reaction (ADR) under real world settings

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with sustained virologic response (SVR) 12 and 24 weeks after discontinuation of therapy (SVR12 and SVR24)
secondary_outcome.description: SVR12 and SVR24 are defined as HCV RNA < the lower limit of quantification (LLOQ) 12 and 24 weeks following the last dose of study drug, respectively.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with HCV NS5A and NS5B resistance associated variants among patients who do not achieve SVR at 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 12 weeks after treatment completion or discontinuation

arm_group.description: Adult patients with chronic genotype 1 HCV infection with or without compensated cirrhosis who take Harvoni as part of routine clinical care at a participating clinic/hospital.

intervention.description: Harvoni (90/400 mg) FDC tablet administered orally once daily

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients with chronic genotype 1 HCV infection with or without compensated cirrhosis who take Harvoni as part of routine clinical care at a participating clinic/hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients with chronic genotype 1 HCV infection with or without compensated cirrhosis
- Patients who are prescribed Harvoni
Exclusion Criteria:
